qas.question: What is the average household size in the city of Ann Arbor?
What is the average family size in the city of Ann Arbor?
What is the median age for the city of Ann Arbor?
In what year was the average family size was 2.22?
What age group did 9.7% of the population fall into?
What age group did 13.7% of the population fall into?
In what year was the median age 82 years old?
When was 87.3% of the population married couples?

context: In <b3_0><b6_0><b7_0>2000<b7_0/><b6_0/><b3_0/>, out of 45,693 households, 23.0% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 37.8% were married couples living together, 7.5% had a female householder with no husband present, and 52.5% were nonfamilies. 35.5% of households were made up of individuals and 6.6% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was <a0_0>2.22<a0_0/> and the average family size was <a1_0>2.90<a1_0/>. The age distribution was 16.8% under 18, 26.8% from 18 to 24, 31.2% from 25 to 44, 17.3% from <b5_0>45 to 64<b5_0/>, and 7.9% were <b4_0>65 or older<b4_0/>. The median age was <a2_0>28<a2_0/> years. For every 100 females there were 97.7 males; while for every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 96.4 males.
